title: Age of Empires III: Complete
notes:
Entering the CD-Key is impossible, unless "corefonts" are installed (The default Font's character width is too large to fit into the Textboxes).
Installing mfc42 is necessary, otherwise the game will throw up a "PID DLL missing" error when attempting to verify the entered CD-Key.

The game starts up, Intro Cutscenes play without any issues. However, instead of showing the Main Menu Screen, the Game crashes.
Launching the Game in a Virtual Desktop results in an infinite loading screen with misplaced textures instead of a crash message.

title: Age of Empires® III: Complete Collection

gpu: Intel Open Source Technology Center Mesa DRI Intel(R) HD Graphics 5500 (Broadwell GT2) x86/MMX/SSE2
notes: Game works with wine if you pick the Windows XP preset on .cfg
title: Age of Empires® III: Complete Collection

notes:
You have to set "Windows Version" to "Windows XP" in winecfg and install l3codecx with winetricks. That's enough to make "Asian Dynasties" (and  "The War Chiefs", but that's less important) playable. I didn't play game much, but as far as I can tell you have access to all content (campaigns, faction, etc.) from main game and "The War Chiefs" expansion  in "Asian Dynasties", so you don't really need to launch main game ("Play Age of Empires III: Complete Collection" in menu), which required key. If for some reason you want to launch it, you have to install mfc42 and (maybe, I don't have to) corefonts with winetricks to make key insert dialog work.

On Debian (and probably on derivatives) Proton prefixes located in the "$HOME/.steam/steam/steamapps/compatdata" directory, so you can do this to launch winetricks for "Age of Empires III":

export WINEPREFIX="$HOME/.steam/steam/steamapps/compatdata/105450/pfx"
winetricks --gui
title: Age of Empires® III: Complete Collection

gpu: X.Org AMD Radeon (TM) RX 480 Graphics (POLARIS10, DRM 3.26.0, 4.18.8-2-MANJARO, LLVM 6.0.1)
notes: After running 'protontricks 105450 mfc42' to get rid of the dll issue with the license key, and ensuring I had corefonts installed, I can get through the opening movies but then it crashes when it tries to load the menu.
title: Age of Empires® III: Complete Collection

notes:
I managed to get it to run by following the steps in this post: https://github.com/ValveSoftware/Proton/issues/17#issuecomment-423592026

I had to edit the path to the steamapps folder location in the post linked to above and in the protontricks Python script, because I've changed the location of the Steam Library folder using the Steam client and it's different from the default location.

There were also a lot of errors and warnings thrown at me as I was installing the required components, but it apparently didn't matter since I was able to play a multi-player game session that lasted for more than an hour and it ran without any noticeable issues.
title: Age of Empires® III: Complete Collection

gpu: Intel Open Source Technology Center Mesa DRI Intel(R) Haswell Server x86/MMX/SSE2
notes: Follow the instructions here and it will work perfectly: https://github.com/ValveSoftware/Proton/issues/17#issuecomment-423592026

title: Age of Empires® III: Complete Collection

notes:
UNOFFICIAL

rm -r "${HOME}/.steam/steam/steamapps/compatdata/105450"

WINEPREFIX="${HOME}/.steam/steam/steamapps/compatdata/105450/pfx/" winetricks d3dx9 mfc42 winxp l3codecx corefonts
